definition:
Suppose $V$ is a finite dimensional vector space over a field
${\mathbbmss{F}}$, and suppose $L\colon V\to V$ is a linear map. Suppose
also that $\lambda\in {\mathbbmss{F}}$ is an eigenvalue of $L$, that is,
$\operatorname{det}( L - \lambda I)=0$.

The *algebrai[c]{} multiplicit[y]{}*, denoted by $A_\lambda(L)$, of
$\lambda$ is the multiplicity of the root $\lambda$ to the polynomial
$\operatorname{det}( L - \lambda I)=0$. The *geometric multiplicity* of
$\lambda$, denoted by $G_\lambda(L)$, is the dimension of
$\ker ( L - \lambda I)$, the eigenspace of $\lambda$.
